meanings.definition: To force or compel someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The teacher was ramrodding the students to finish their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: The boss was ramrodding the employees to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The coach was ramrodding the team to practice harder for the upcoming game.
meanings.sent4: The strict rules were ramrodding everyone into following them without question.
meanings.sent5: The storm ramrodding through the town left a trail of destruction.

meanings.definition: To push or drive something forcefully
meanings.sent1: He was ramrodding the heavy cart up the hill with all his strength.
meanings.sent2: The workers were ramrodding the crates onto the truck for delivery.
meanings.sent3: The wind was ramrodding the leaves across the yard in a playful dance.
meanings.sent4: The waves ramrodding against the shore created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The bulldozer was ramrodding through the debris to clear the path.

meanings.definition: To manage or control a situation aggressively
meanings.sent1: The politician was ramrodding the debate with his strong opinions.
meanings.sent2: The CEO was ramrodding the board meeting to ensure decisions were made quickly.
meanings.sent3: The chef was ramrodding the kitchen during the dinner rush.
meanings.sent4: The captain was ramrodding the team to victory with strategic plays.
meanings.sent5: The general was ramrodding the battle plan with precision and determination.
